content.raw:
Do you have information about these crashes?
With a shared_pointer, perhaps instances are kept around when they shouldn't.
content.html: Do you have information about these crashes? With a shared_pointer, perhaps instances are kept around when they shouldn't.

content.raw:
This is the problem I briefly explain in the PR description. There are segfaults trying to access a vector (using methods like `size()`, `end()`, `empty()`...)

You can reproduce it by changing this to a `unique_ptr`, making a building that has a window on a wall and then exit the editor - sometimes it crashes.
content.html:
This is the problem I briefly explain in the PR description. There are segfaults trying to access a vector (using methods like size(), end(), empty()...)

You can reproduce it by changing this to a unique_ptr, making a building that has a window on a wall and then exit the editor - sometimes it crashes.

content.raw:
I dug a bit more and realized there were problems in the way we were passing around raw pointers of `BuildingModelManip`. To fix that, I removed the logic where a manip would keep a vector of raw pointers with other manips. This vector seemed to be the problem with timely deleting all these pointers.

In place of that, now all the attachment logic is handled by the `BuildingMaker`, using strings instead of pointers.
content.html:
I dug a bit more and realized there were problems in the way we were passing around raw pointers of BuildingModelManip. To fix that, I removed the logic where a manip would keep a vector of raw pointers with other manips. This vector seemed to be the problem with timely deleting all these pointers.

In place of that, now all the attachment logic is handled by the BuildingMaker, using strings instead of pointers.

Forward declare with:

namespace gazebo
{
  namespace common
  {
    class Color;
  }
  ...

content.raw: Actually I'll remove all deprecations. This header is not installed, so we should be free to make changes.
content.html: Actually I'll remove all deprecations. This header is not installed, so we should be free to make changes.
The member has been removed 2f6d4c2

content.raw: Add `#include` for the ignition math classes used.
content.html: Add #include for the ignition math classes used.

content.raw:
While PIMPLizing, an issue involving passing around raw pointers surfaced. To fix that, I refactored the way we manage which items are attached to each other.

[new build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/735/) clean
content.html:
While PIMPLizing, an issue involving passing around raw pointers surfaced. To fix that, I refactored the way we manage which items are attached to each other.

new build clean

content.raw:
Should this change be in the migration guide?
(also applies to the others getters)
content.html: Should this change be in the migration guide? (also applies to the others getters)

content.raw: I actually just removed them from the migration guide together with the deprecation warnings. No headers in the building editor are being installed, so even changes to public members are not important for users.
content.html: I actually just removed them from the migration guide together with the deprecation warnings. No headers in the building editor are being installed, so even changes to public members are not important for users.
